column1: Why didnt stalin look both ways before he crossed the road? he was rushin
column3: In the context of the joke, rush can mean to hurry and also refers to a rush of a vehicle in traffic.
column4: He decided to rush to the station to catch the last train.
column5: The rush caused by the speeding car startled the pedestrians.

column1: How many tickles does it take to tickle an octopus? tentacles!
column3: Tentacles can mean the limbs of an octopus and also refers to flexible, elongated structures in a different context.
column4: The octopus wrapped its tentacles around the rock for stability.
column5: The inventor designed new tentacles for the robotic arm to increase its reach.

column1: What did the unused dough say to the baker? why dont you knead me?
column3: Knead refers to the process of working dough and can also be interpreted as needing someone or something.
column4: To make bread, you must knead the dough thoroughly.
column5: Sometimes, I feel like I knead more support from my friends.
